---
title: "Laboratory analysis"
output: html_notebook
---


```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(dygraphs)
library(zoo)
```

```{r}
labs <- read.csv("../data/lt-covid19-laboratory.csv") %>% mutate(day = ymd(day))
```

```{r}
labs1 <- labs %>% arrange(day, lab_name, test_type) %>% group_by(lab_name, test_type) %>% 
     mutate(
               tests_sum7 = rollsum(tests, 7, fill = NA, align = "right"),
               tests_sum14 = rollsum(tests, 14, fill = NA, align = "right"),
               tests_positive_sum7 = rollsum(tests_positive, 7, fill = NA, align = "right"),
               tests_positive_sum14 = rollsum(tests_positive, 14, fill = NA, align = "right"),
               tpn7 = round(100 * tests_positive_sum7/tests_sum7,2),
               tpn14 = round(100 * tests_positive_sum14/tests_sum14,2),
               tpn = round(100 * tests_positive/tests,2))

top_lab <- labs1 %>% filter(test_type == 1477) %>% group_by(lab_name) %>% summarise(tests = sum(tests)) %>% arrange(-tests)
top10 <- top_lab %>% select(lab_name) %>% slice_head(n = 10) %>% .$lab_name

```

```{r}
ggplot(aes(x = day, y = tpn7, group = lab_name), data = labs1 %>% filter(test_type == 1477, lab_name %in% top10)) + geom_line() + fac
```

```{r}
ggplot(aes(x = day, y = tpn7, group = lab_name, colour = lab_name), data = labs1 %>% filter(test_type == 1477, lab_name %in% top10)) + geom_line()
```

```{r}
ggplot(aes(x = day, y = tpn7), data = labs1 %>% filter(test_type == 1477, lab_name %in% top10)) + geom_line() + facet_wrap(~lab_name)
```
